Acceptance & Commitment Therapy

Master your emotions and follow your dreams.
Acceptance and Commitment Therapy or ACT is a beautiful fusion of different philosophies. Based on research-based mindfulness and behavioural principles, it’s one of the ultimate approaches to managing your emotional experience, understanding your values and living a purpose driven life. It helps you to create a rich, full and meaningful life, while accepting the pain that inevitably goes with it.

ACT is a therapeutic approach based on core principles aimed at helping you to develop “psychological flexibility”. Being psychologically flexible means you’re aware of your thoughts and feelings but you hold them lightly, instead acting on longer-term values that contribute to a rich and meaningful life. ACT is based on the following six principles:

Defusion

The ability to perceive your thoughts for what they are (a bunch of words that pop into your mind frequently) and to relate to them so they have less influence over you. As you learn to defuse from unhelpful thoughts (e.g., self-criticism, worry, rumination, etc), they will have less influence over your behaviour.

Acceptance

Opening up and making space for unpleasant feelings or sensations. The more you allow yourself to feel your feelings, the less struggle you will experience. Conversely, when you suppress your feelings or pretend they’re not there, they tend to come back stronger than ever.

Contact with the present moment

Being able to fully connect with the here and now, focusing and engaging in whatever you’re doing (instead of thinking about the past or the future).

Tapping into your observing self

The more you tap into the part of you who is aware of your own experiences (but who is not those experiences), the more acquainted you’ll become with your difficult thoughts and feelings, thus changing your relationship with them.

Values

Exploring and connecting with your values is an essential step in ACT and in living a meaningful life. Your values reflect what is truly important to you, and give you direction to live your life accordingly.

Committed action

This refers to actions that are driven by your values and that you do consistently. ACT brings together the best elements of different approaches, incorporating mindfulness wisdom, behavioural psychology and values- based theory to create a unique experience.
